title: Build professional dashboard UI for construction monitoring system

requirements.text: Create a Login page with centered card layout containing email field, password field, and login button. Style with deep blue primary color and gray secondary color using Tailwind CSS.

quotes: Login Page - Email field - Password field - Login button - Simple modern centered card layout

acceptanceCriteria: Login form is centered on the page in a card layout
Email and password input fields are present
Login button uses deep blue primary color
Layout is responsive and professional

requirements.text: Create a Dashboard page with sidebar navigation (Dashboard, Upload Progress, Projects, Logout), top navbar displaying 'AI-Assisted Construction Progress Monitoring System', and three statistics cards showing Total Projects, Active Projects, and Last Updated Project. Use card-based layout with deep blue and gray color scheme.

quotes: Sidebar navigation (Dashboard, Upload Progress, Projects, Logout)
Cards showing: - Total Projects - Active Projects - Last Updated Project

acceptanceCriteria: Sidebar contains Dashboard, Upload Progress, Projects, and Logout navigation items
Top navbar displays the project name
Three statistics cards are visible with mock data
Layout uses professional government/enterprise styling
Design is responsive across screen sizes

requirements.text: Add a projects table to the Dashboard page displaying Project Name, Stage, Progress %, Last Updated Date, and a View Details button for each row. Use mock data for the table entries.

quotes: Table listing projects: - Project Name - Stage - Progress % - Last Updated Date - View Details button

acceptanceCriteria: Table displays all specified columns
Mock data populates multiple project rows
View Details button is present for each project
Table styling matches the professional theme
Table is responsive on smaller screens

requirements.text: Create an Upload Progress page with a form card containing: Project dropdown selector, Number of Buildings input field, Construction Stage dropdown (Foundation, Superstructure, Facade, Interiors, Furnishing), and a drag-and-drop style image upload box. Include Submit button, error alert UI component, and success notification component.

quotes: Fields: - Project dropdown - Number of Buildings input - Construction Stage dropdown (Foundation, Superstructure, Facade, Interiors, Furnishing) - Image upload box (drag & drop style)
Submit button - Error alert UI component - Success notification component

acceptanceCriteria: Form is contained in a clean card layout
Project dropdown includes mock project options
Construction Stage dropdown contains all five specified stages
Image upload area supports drag-and-drop UI interaction
Submit button is styled consistently
Alert and notification components can display success/error states

requirements.text: Create a Project Details page displaying: project name header, current stage badge, large progress percentage display, progress bar, timeline graph placeholder (Recharts compatible structure), image history gallery, and a comparison section showing Previous Stage, Current Stage, and Progress Increase percentage. Use mock data throughout.

quotes: Project name at top - Current stage badge - Progress percentage large display - Progress bar - Timeline graph placeholder (Recharts compatible) - Image history gallery - Comparison section: - Previous Stage - Current Stage - Progress Increase %

acceptanceCriteria: Project name is prominently displayed at the top
Stage badge uses appropriate styling with color coding
Progress percentage is shown in large, readable text
Progress bar visually represents completion
Timeline graph area has placeholder structure for Recharts integration
Image gallery displays multiple mock construction images
Comparison section clearly shows previous vs current stage with percentage increase

requirements.text: Create reusable components: Card component for content containers, Button component with primary/secondary variants, Alert component for error/success messages, and responsive Sidebar component. All components should use Tailwind CSS with deep blue primary color, gray secondary color, modern rounded corners, and soft shadows.

quotes: Reusable Card component - Reusable Button component - Reusable Alert component - Responsive sidebar

acceptanceCriteria: Card component accepts children and has consistent padding and shadow
Button component supports primary and secondary color variants
Alert component can display error and success states
Sidebar is responsive and collapses appropriately on mobile
All components use the specified color scheme
Components follow clean, readable code structure

requirements.text: Organize all React components in a structured folder hierarchy with clean, readable code. Use functional components throughout and ensure responsive design across all pages using Tailwind CSS mobile-first approach.

quotes: Ensure code is clean and readable

acceptanceCriteria: Components are organized in logical folder structure
All components are functional (not class-based)
Code follows consistent formatting and naming conventions
All pages are responsive and work on mobile, tablet, and desktop
Tailwind CSS classes are used throughout without custom CSS

constraints: Use only deep blue as primary color and gray as secondary color
No backend logic or integration required
Use mock data for all tables, charts, and statistics
Must use Tailwind CSS exclusively for styling
All components must be React functional components
nonGoals: Image processing or AI analysis features
